Title: Mixed feelings

I don't think it's great for the bottom of the pool though, the plastic rim is too stiff and I just couldn't get the right angle to pick up anything on the pool floor. Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019
Author: Gegeneis
Title: ProTuff 17" Pool Silt Net is a good quality net
Body: The ProTuff 17" Pool Silt Net has some good qualities and some just adequate qualities.  First,  it is a rugged net and it does an excellent job of skimming and holding things that are on top of the pool water.  The only critique I have is that the opening could be larger.  The Pool net does a marginal job at taking out silt and I think it would behoove ProTuff to  re-engineer the front gathering part of the net.  The design does not adequately gather the silt and small bugs (Potatoe bugs to exact) off the bottom.  If the front part was a bit longer and tilted more for gathering items off the bottom, It would be a "can't be beat" Pool Silt net.  To summarize: Excellent durability, Excellent top water debris collector, Average silt/particle scoop off bottom of pool.
